solution_line_template: For each liter of chlorine, I can save ${chlorine_price} x {chlorine_discount_decimal} = $<<{chlorine_price}*{chlorine_discount_decimal}={chlorine_savings_per_liter}>>{chlorine_savings_per_liter}.
For each box of soap, I can save ${soap_price} x {soap_discount_decimal} = $<<{soap_price}*{soap_discount_decimal}={soap_savings_per_box}>>{soap_savings_per_box}.

With the {num_chlorine} liters of chlorine, I can save ${chlorine_savings_per_liter} x {num_chlorine} = $<<{num_chlorine}*{chlorine_savings_per_liter}={total_chlorine_savings}>>{total_chlorine_savings}.
With the {num_soap} boxes of soap, I can save ${soap_savings_per_box} x {num_soap} = $<<{soap_savings_per_box}*{num_soap}={total_soap_savings}>>{total_soap_savings}.
Therefore, I can save a total of ${total_chlorine_savings} + ${total_soap_savings} = $<<{total_chlorine_savings}+{total_soap_savings}={total_savings}>>{total_savings}.
